Soccer (aka FOOTBALL) is THE most popular and fastest growing sport in the world. Nearly every nation has their own FA (football association) and league competition. 
 
 What are the prospects of soccer's popularity in the USA, in light of huge competition from MLB, NBA, NFL, and NHL?

Of course soccer is successful around the world.
 It's cheap. 
 
 I don't expect American audiences to accept soccer anytime soon.
 The NFL is ripping everyone up and the NHL, MLB, and NBA maintain their core markets.
 
 There's no room for soccer.

I think when American teams prove that they can compete with the rest of the world, soccer will become more popular in the US. Americans like to be on top, and in soccer, we've been way down at the bottom. However, that is changing, and when we make the top 4 at a world cup or something like that, I think America will grow to accept soccer as another sport.

Americans could easily be World Cup champions...if they cared. Some countries have government agencies set up just to recruit kids for their national teams. Others just don't have any other major sports taking away athletes.

There are people who care...there just aren't enough of them. To be able to have recruiters, you have to have money, and that hasn't been readily available in the past. However, with America's success in the World Cup and the formation of a true D1 league, along with the added cash coming from these two, America could become another soccer power.

I know this is an old topic, but I feel like raising a point.
 
 Crim bring on a good point that soccer players are tougher and have more endurance. Some soccer players play with injuries that they have sustained for a long time. David Beckham for instance played on a bad ankle during the England vs. Japan game during the 2002 FIFA World Cup. It's not that they are tougher, they just have more a love for the game. Also Soccer has its roots deeper in other countries. Government agencies do not start up leagues, its actually U-16 Leagues. In countries such as England, France, and Italy all of the club teams have academies that recruit at any age. Most of the soccer players have been playing for that league since the age of 12, you just don't see them play. Also, something you don't realize is that you can be any age and play in the World Cup (12 or older i believe not sure on this). If you want proof, the Russian Women's Team had a 16 year-old Striker. Where have you seen that in Football, Baseball, Hockey, etc. etc.? I think the only sports that do that is Tennis and Golf(not sure on the golf)

Where have you seen that in Football, Baseball, Hockey, etc. etc.?
